posts.post_content:
I liked this card, then I saw it wasn't an Un-card and I loved it.  
  
They need to print more cards like this. Cards that are fun, social, unique, and require skill beyond splurging for [Angelic Destiny](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Angelic Destiny).

Posted By: Salient (1/25/2012 3:43:33 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@murdershot21: It says in the errata, "When it comes to choice of items, use common sense. Items should be small enough to hide but large enough to count. Make it clear what kind of object you are hiding beforehand. For example, one player may choose coins and the other may choose dice. If you can't find something convenient to hide, write numbers on a piece of paper and reveal the numbers. Make sure the numbers are unambiguous (for example, underline a 6 or 9 so it can't be misread)."  
  
Another interesting piece of errata: "If you attempt to halve a negative life total, you halve 0. This means that the life total stays the same. A life total of -10 would remain -10."  
  
Doesn't seem very relevant, but I guess it could save someone if they played a life gain card as an interrupt. Speaking of which... Based on the wording of this card, you could potentially play instants in response to someone revealing their item.  
  
"I have a penci - "  
  
"SUDDEN DEATH!!!"  
  
"... Why?"  
  
"I just wanted to pl... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:

Make it clear what kind of object you are hiding beforehand. For example, one player may choose coins and the other may choose dice. If you can't find something convenient to hide, write numbers on a piece of paper and reveal the numbers. Make sure the numbers are unambiguous (for example, underline a 6 or 9 so it can't be misread)."

Another interesting piece of errata: "If you attempt to halve a negative life total, you halve 0. This means that the life total stays the same. A life total of -10 would remain -10."

Doesn't seem very relevant, but I guess it could save someone if they played a life gain card as an interrupt. Speaking of which... Based on the wording of this card, you could potentially play instants in response to someone revealing their item.

Posted By: Etregan (12/3/2009 3:11:22 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: @TopRomen: No, you couldn't do that. The revealing of the items is part of the spell's resolution, and you can't do things in response to other things while spells resolve.
posts.html:
@TopRomen: No, you couldn't do that. The revealing of the items is part of the spell's resolution, and you can't do things in response to other things while spells resolve.

Posted By: Joseph_Leito (8/6/2009 7:36:06 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Play it with [Wound Reflection](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wound Reflection). If you have more life than your opponent you will win. He will not be able to hide more items than half his life. You will hide items equal to half his life +1 making him loose tha Goblin Game thus loosing half of his life (all of it with Wound Reflection).

posts.post_content: In short, this card reads: "each player loses a good chunk of life", which is obviously better than damage since it can't be prevented. It also puts players in a lose/lose situation. If they bid too much they have about lost anyway, and if they don't, then they lose even more.
